newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: Sri Lanka Tamil rebels attack police, kill six.
newsitem.headline: Sri Lanka Tamil rebels attack police, kill six.

text.p: Sri Lanka's Tamil Tiger rebels killed six policemen when they attacked a police post in eastern Trincomalee district on Sunday, military officials in the east said.

They said about 25 Liberation Tigers of Tamil Eelam (LTTE) rebels attacked the police post at Pallikdiyurippu near Trincomalee, 240 km (150 miles) east of the capital Colombo. Two civilians were also wounded in the attack, they said.
"An army platoon had rushed to site and it had opened mortar fire at the terrorists," a military official said in Trincomalee.
He said the rebels had escaped but it was believed that they suffered some casualties. The wounded civilians were admitted to hospital in Trincomalee.
Earlier on Sunday the LTTE had ambushed an army road-clearing patrol in Trincomalee district, killing 21 soldiers, military officials said.

The LTTE are fighting for a separate homeland for minority Tamils in Sri Lanka's north and east. The government says more than 50,000 people have been killed in the war, now in its 14th year. The LTTE says the number is higher.
